availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William Sears (Whitley County, Kentucky, farmer, boat builder, and capt 7th Ky Inf USA)

body.p: Whitley County, Kentucky, farmer, boat builder, and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Melvina Jane Early Sears in Whitley County, Kentucky, on August 9, 1848. Father of Mary Sears. Married to Mary Pemberton in Whitley County on December 24, 1860. Farmer in Whitley County in 1850. Boat builder in Whitley County in 1860. Served in the 7th Kentucky Volunteer Infantry Regiment (U.S.A.) as a captain from September 22, 1861, to August 5, 1863.

ab.bibl:
